short_summary: Stage 1- Lake Audy Road Crossing Replacements in Riding Mountain National Park
description: Parks Canada is accepting bids for a project to reconstruct the Lake Audy Road Crossings over Jackfish Creek at Km 18 and 26 in Riding Mountain National Park.
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

**Title:** Lake Audy Road Crossing Replacements

**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0049/A

**Closes:** May 16, 2023, at 16:00:00 hours

**Estimated Contract Value:** Between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000, exclusive of taxes

**Project Overview:**
The Parks Canada Agency is seeking a contractor to replace the Lake Audy Road Crossings over Jackfish Creek at Km 18 and 26 in Riding Mountain National Park. The work involves constructing corrugated plate arch structures with concrete footings to ensure proper seating of the arch structure. Erosion protection measures will also be implemented to maintain water flow and protect aquatic habitats during construction.

**Tender Requirements:**

* Bids must be submitted via fax or email to the designated contact.
* A Two-Envelope Invitation to Tender (ITT) will be used for the evaluation process, with a technical evaluation component and a price evaluation component.
* Interested suppliers must obtain documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca).
* Addenda, when issued, will be available from the Government of Canada tendering service.
* Suppliers who elect to base their bids on documents obtained from other sources do so at their own risk.
* Late submissions will not be considered.

**Contracting Information:**

* Contracting Authority: Parks Canada
* Contact Information: Carmen Song, soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca, (604) 358-9479
* Address: 30, rue Victoria, Gatineau, Québec J8X 0B3
* Government of Canada tendering service: [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca)

**Important Notes:**

* This is a two-stage selection process. Bidders will be required to submit a bid in two stages: a Qualification Stage and a Bid Stage.
* The first stage will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers.
* The second stage will invite qualified suppliers to submit an Indigenous Benefits Plan and provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.
* The list of qualified suppliers from the first stage will expire 180 days after the start of the contract or upon the completion of the contract, whichever comes first.
